author: misskuke
title: Tiny but good!
text:
My husband and I stayed here for two nights in February.
The hotel is easy to find and very well located for the metro, as well as being surrounded by multiple restaurants, cafes and bars.
The hotel is modern with super friendly and helpful staff.
Our room was on the 4th floor and although it was small (as expected) it had everything we needed and was spotlessly clean.
The only reason I've given this hotel a four is because either our AC wasn't working, or the room was just very hot and airless! Despite reviews saying that the street noise was awful, we actually slept with the window (actually more like a door!) open all night and weren't really disturbed. We didn't bring this up with the hotel staff as it wasn't really a problem.
Other tiny negatives were that we only got one small bottle of water in the room, for two guests, and the cups were paper.. They came with lids which is great if you want to take them out, but less useful if you want to make more than one cup whilst in the room.
Breakfast was plentiful and fresh - Its served buffet style, and there was a choice of coffee machines (more standard or a lovely Nespresso).
Overall I'd definitely stay here again, it was excellent value.
Green Features: Very good, notices in the room and towels/bedding not changed unnecessarily.
